title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.9.1 | 23-03-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare, Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: The chapter title is the passing away of Bhishma Deva in the presence of Lord Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the chapter from Srimad Bhagavatam, focusing on Bhishma Deva's passing in Krishna's presence.

segments.key_quote: Those who are Krishna conscious at the time of death, they don't have to take birth again in this material world they straight go back to Godhead
segments.summary: The speaker explains the significance of Bhishma's instructions to Yudhishthira and the liberation attained through Krishna consciousness at the time of death, referencing Srila Prabhupada's purport.

segments.key_quote: Mortal world is the place of death there is no such depth in the spiritual world because in the spiritual world nobody has a material body everybody has spiritual form
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the material world of birth and death with the eternal spiritual world, emphasizing the spiritual form in the spiritual realm.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma Deva was endowed with the power of leaving his material body at will...Bhishma Deva's passing away is a lesson for all of us...how he perfectly quit his body in full Krishna consciousness
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on Bhishma's ability to choose the time of his death and how his passing away serves as an example of achieving perfection in life through Krishna consciousness.

segments.key_quote: Praja just doesn't mean the human population of a particular place it means all the living beings or creatures were born in a particular place
segments.summary: The speaker explains the meaning of 'Praja' as all living beings, not just humans, and emphasizes the king's responsibility to protect all creatures within his domain.

segments.key_quote: The very conception is not limited just to humans as praja as as those to be protected by the king it is even the animals particularly the cows
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Yudhishthira's concern for all living beings killed in the war, especially cows, and reinforces the king's duty to protect them.

segments.key_quote: Bhishma took that vow simply to please his father to render some service to his father
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Yudhishthira's confusion and introduces Bhishma's vow of lifelong Brahmacharya to please his father.

segments.key_quote: It is Krishna's will that Bhishma will impart instructions to Yudhishthira...In that most uncomfortable position Bhishma is speaking perfectly and instructing Yudhishthira in the matter of Dharma
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that Bhishma's instructions to Yudhishthira are Krishna's will, even in Bhishma's difficult situation on the bed of arrows.

segments.key_quote: Dharma does not mean some religious faith as people think Dharma means the occupational duty occupational duty...In the presence of Krishna, Bhishma was fortunate to quit his body.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that Dharma means occupational duty and highlights the significance of Bhishma's fortunate passing in Krishna's presence, concluding the lecture.
